A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Interesting themes\, decent surprises\, and a few fun action scenes can not save this disaster. 2 and half hours bored me terribly\, a feeling I have never had in a Star Wars film. Even the prequels were never boring. Why did we spend probably about 40 minutes following a new character and the comic relief on a video-game quest that has no connection to the deep themes or the character development of Finn? Also\, the CGI was so noticeable in this one that it looked cheesy. At least when I walked out of the prequels\, I was blown away by the special effects and only after watching those films age did I see those effects degrade. This movie feels like the first draft of a film that needed more clarification\, editing\, and common sense.
